questions.question: What is the activation energy of MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2?
What method was used for the structure determination and refinements of synchrotron XPD data?
How does the proton conductivity of MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 change with relative humidity?
questions.answer: The activation energy of MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 rises gradually with decreasing RH, indicating a change from the Grötthuss mechanism to the Vehicular mechanism under lower humidity.

questions.question: Is the structure of MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 retained after two years of storage under ambient conditions?
questions.answer: Yes, the structure and proton conductivity of MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 are retained after two years of being stored under ambient conditions.

questions.question: What is the role of water molecules in MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 according to the FT-IR spectra analysis?
questions.answer: Water molecules play an important role in assembling efficient hydrogen-bonding networks and achieving low activation energy in MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2.

questions.question: What technique was used to probe the proton dynamics in MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2?
Is the proton conduction in MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 temperature-dependent?
questions.answer: No, the proton conductivity of MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 was found to be almost independent of temperature.

questions.question: What is the main mechanism for long-range proton transfer in MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 under >50% RH conditions?
questions.answer: Hopping through hydrogen-bonding networks is the dominant mechanism for long-range proton transfer in MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 under >50% RH conditions.

questions.question: What additional bands are observed for MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 in the FT-IR spectra, indicating the presence of sulfate species?
questions.answer: Additional bands at 1233 and 1140 cm-1, resulting from asymmetric and symmetric ν(S=O) stretching modes, indicate the presence of sulfate species.

questions.question: Does the proton transportation in MFM-300(Cr)-SO4(H3O)2 involve long-range displacement according to MD simulation?
questions.answer: Yes, protons in the presence of SO4(2-) species and H2O/H3O+ are mobile with long-range displacement according to MD simulation.
